triples.name: Graph neural network
triples.relevance: The paper builds upon existing graph neural network methods and compares them with hypergraph neural networks.

triples.name: Hypergraph
triples.relevance: Hypergraphs are the fundamental mathematical structure underlying hypergraph neural networks that the paper extends.

triples.name: Heterophily
triples.relevance: The paper addresses heterophilic hypergraph learning, extending the heterophily concept from graphs to hypergraphs.

triples.name: Homophily
triples.relevance: Homophily is the counterpart to heterophily, used to measure the tendency of connected nodes to be similar.

triples.name: Low-pass filter
triples.relevance: The proposed HyperUFG model integrates low-pass filters as a key component for processing high-order correlations.

triples.name: High-pass filter
triples.relevance: The proposed HyperUFG model integrates high-pass filters to handle heterophilic patterns in hypergraphs.

triples.name: Wavelet
triples.relevance: Framelets are based on wavelet theory; HyperUFG uses a framelet-based approach to design the neural network.

triples.name: List of datasets for machine-learning research
triples.relevance: The paper develops diverse benchmark datasets for heterophilic hypergraph learning across various real-world scenarios.
